repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: This manuscript belonged to Édouard-Simon Ariel's (1818-1854) collection. The author lists a total of 517 verb roots that are organized into seven different booklets according to their initial letter. Letters run from அ to ச.
Indien 161 is the second volume of Tamil verb roots.
Description based on the digitized version.

support.p: As in manuscript BnF Indien 194 from the same author, different kinds of paper are found: a) brownish and thick paper; b) a light yellowish colour; c) a darker yellowish colour paper. Two other kinds of paper are also found: a) a light blue colour and b) ruled paper. Examples of kind a) can be found at ff. 31, 38, 51, 56, 60, 75, 79, 126, 135, 161, 175, 192, 198, 217, 229, 253, 274, 312, 320, 329, 360, 367, 415, 430, 458, 499, 504, 505, 506, 529, 531, 532. Example of kind b) are found at ff. 204 and 377.

extent.measure: 1 + 533 + 1 (u1 + U1+ u2). 1 front guard leaf + 533 + 1 back guard leaf.

supportDesc.foliation: Foliation starts with the number 1 and it is regularly found on the upper right side of the recto of each folio. It goes from 1r to 432r. There is only one occurrence in which there is another crossed-out number (395) next to the one representing the main foliation, e.g. f170r.

1 folio = back guard leaf. No foliation.

layoutDesc.layout: The layout of the page is not organised. There are many erasure marks.

handNote.desc: The handwriting by Edouard Ariel is difficult to read. For some verb root, a corresponding Sanskrit form written in Devanagari script is provided. Examples may be found at ff. 11r, 17r, 22r, 35v, 44r, 50r, 110r, 112r, 125r, 136r, 137r, 142r, 146r-v, 147r, 151r, 164r, 301r, 326r, 354r, 435r, 436r, 439r, 441r, 442r, 443r, 445r, 447r, 448r, 449r, 450r, 467r, 468v, 477r, 481, 500, 501, 503, 525r, 528r.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker INDIEN 160 (front cover, verso).

There are two different stamps found at the beginning and at the end of each booklet. The first one is a red circle containing an eagle and the inscription Bibliothèque Impériale MSS. This is the stamp in use from 1852 to 1870 (cf. stamp n. 36 in Josserand and Bruno 1960: 282). The second one is a red oval containing the writing Don n°. Example of this combination can be found at ff. 2r, 105r, 159r, 226r, 262r, 295r, 434r. The number of donation is not specified, however the handwriting, as well as the paper used allow to identify it as a manuscript belonging to Ariel whose collection was transferred from the Société Asiatique to the BnF in 1866 (Berthier 2000: 61). In some other cases only the first stamp is found like at ff. 103v, 157v, 224v, 260v, 293v, 432v, 532v.
Two numbers of a previous cataloguing: 1. number 7481 written in pencil and crossed out with red colour; 2. number 159 written in substitution of the previous one in red colour. (f[1]r).

Intertitles on their own page:
Radicaux tamils. அ.ஆ. (f. 1r). This booklet includes 101 verb forms.
Radicaux tamils. இ.ஈ. (f 104r). The long ī differs from the short one for having a loop at the end of the drawing line in. However, in the following page the actual Tamil letter (ஈ) for long ī is used. This booklet includes 52 verb forms.
Radicaux tamils. உ.ஊ. (f. 158r). This booklet includes 65 verb forms.
Radicaux tamils. எ.ஏ.ஐ. (f. 225r) (original foliation 366). This booklet includes 34 verb forms.
Radicaux tamils. ஒ.ஓ.ஔ. (f. 261r). This booklet includes 31 verb froms.
Radicaux tamils. க. (f. 294r). This booklet includes 137 verb forms.
Radicaux tamils. ச. (f. 433r). This booklet includes 98 verb froms.

binding.p: Hard paper covers, marbled on the outside. It is a collection of loose folios, sometimes of different size and colours, collected togheter.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Being a manusript by Ariel, the date of composition is based on his permanence in Pondicherry where he arrived in 1844 as a French Marine Officer after having studied with Eugène Burnof (1801-1852) in Paris (see James: 198-199).

acquisition.p: It entered the Bibliothèque Nationale with Ariel's collection in 1866 (see Berthier 2000: 61).
